item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2015/07/15/ad-blockers/#comment-4363">julien51</a>.
What do you consider good alternatives to ads? It seems like ads is still the most common approach for sites to generate revenue.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to julien51.

What do you consider good alternatives to ads? It seems like ads is still the most common approach for sites to generate revenue.

item.title: By: julien51
item.dc:creator: julien51
item.description: Generally, I'd rather not use an ad-blocker, but I'd also like more companies to think deeper about their choice of putting ads on their sites/contents... because it's clearly not the only way to monetize content anymore!
item.content:encoded: Generally, I’d rather not use an ad-blocker, but I’d also like more companies to think deeper about their choice of putting ads on their sites/contents… because it’s clearly not the only way to monetize content anymore!

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2015/07/15/ad-blockers/#comment-4361">Chris Reynolds</a>.
The ad blocker plugins are doing some amount of work, and I'd rather not need to use one.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Chris Reynolds.

The ad blocker plugins are doing some amount of work, and I’d rather not need to use one.

item.title: By: Chris Reynolds
item.dc:creator: Chris Reynolds
item.description: I read a while ago that because of all the extra processing power that AdBlock and other similar ad blockers need, it actually makes your browser and computer much slower to run one. But then I tried <em>not</em> running an ad blocker and using an IP blacklist in my hosts file and that <em>actually</em> made most sites unusable...like, completely unusable, I couldn't even log in to some sites that required a login.
item.content:encoded: I read a while ago that because of all the extra processing power that AdBlock and other similar ad blockers need, it actually makes your browser and computer much slower to run one. But then I tried not running an ad blocker and using an IP blacklist in my hosts file and that actually made most sites unusable…like, completely unusable, I couldn’t even log in to some sites that required a login.
